page.title: 18JODRELL BANK (EDUCATION)
page.content:
The Nuffield radio astronomy laboratories form part of the Physics department of Manchester University. The director is Professor F. Graham Smith, who took over in 1982 from the founding director, Professor Sir Bernard Lovell.
The staff consists of two Professors, a Reader and 13 lecturers. The Engineering, Technical and Admin staff plus research fellows and students bring the total complement to 130+.
The Academic staff divide their time between research and teaching. Undergraduate teaching takes place in the University. A Postgraduate course for an M.Sc. or Diploma Of Advanced Studies in Science (DASS) is held at Jodrell Bank. Suitable students may then pursue research for a Ph.D.
